definitions.definition: a limited number or amount of people or things that is officially allowed

examples.text: to introduce a strict import quota on grain
Many countries are still exceeding their quotas.
national quotas on imports of cars
the introduction of EU milk quotas

definitions.definition: an amount of something that somebody expects or needs to have or achieve

examples.text: I'm going home now—I've done my quota of work for the day.
to get your full quota of sleep
Members of the military forces must fulfil a daily quota of work in the fields.
The show is good fun and yields its full quota of laughs.
He never takes his full quota of holidays.
We had to increase our output to fill the quota by the end of the year.

definitions.definition: a fixed number of votes that a candidate needs in order to be elected

examples.text: He was 76 votes short of the quota.

wordOrigin: early 17th cent.: from medieval Latin quota (pars) ‘how great (a part)’, feminine of quotus, from quot ‘how many’.
